FsF_F2_01M-1-2-3.creator: Michael Hoffman, Kellee Koenig, Gill Bunting, Jennifer Costanza, Kristen J. Williams
FsF_F2_01M-1-2-3.title: Biodiversity Hotspots (version 2016.1)
FsF_F2_01M-1-2-3.summary: There are currently 36 recognized biodiversity hotspots. Earth's most biologically rich yet threatened terrestrial regions. To qualify, an area must have at least 1,500 endemic vascular plant species and have lost at least 70% of its original native vegetation. Many hotspots far exceed these thresholds; for example, the Sundaland in Southeast Asia and the Tropical Andes in South America each host around 15,000 endemic plant species, with vegetation loss reaching up to 95% in some areas.
